oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-07-19 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 19, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Marty Robbins (host/performer) with Tompall and the Glaser Brothers, guest performers Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles (although Benny Martin was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Floyd Cramer. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 980th broadcast, and that Cowboy Copas is scheduled to be the host the following week, with guest George Jones.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Carlisles; Floyd Cramer; Marty Robbins; Glaser Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Marty Robbins introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Minnie Pearl, Marty Robbins) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Marty Robbins introduces the Carlisles -- He's Got The Whole World In His Hands (Carlisles) -- Marty Robbins introduces Floyd Cramer -- Beer Barrel Polka (Floyd Cramer) -- Marty Robbins and Grant Turner talks -- Just Married (Marty Robbins, Glaser Brothers) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Marty Robbins) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Jackson, Tommy; Cramer, Floyd, 1933-1997; Robbins, Marty; Tompall & the Glaser Brothers; Carlisle, Bill; Carlisles (Musical group)
